item.title: A Wishlist For Verifiable Computation
item.description: A wishlist for verifiable computation: An applied computer science perspective http://www.pepper-project.org/ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z4jzA6ts2j4 http://simons.berkeley.edu/talks/mike-walfish-2015-06-10 slides: http://www.pepper-project.org/surveywishlist.pptx slides (again): http://simons.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/docs/3316/surveywishlist2.pptx more: http://www.pepper-project.org/talks.htm Okay, thanks. I want to begin by thanking the organizers, especially the tall guy for allowing me to be here. This talk will be talking about a research area where the goal is deployable systems for verifiable computation for probabilistic proofs like SNARKs etc. The goal of this talk is to motivate the next theoretical steps in this area.
